Key Match Events: Son Heung-min scored a brace with a penalty and a clever header from a corner.
Cho Gue-sung headed just over the bar when unmarked from a corner.
Hwang In-beom’s direct free-kick fizzed just past the post midway through the half.
China defender Zhu Chenjie cleared off the line before Jung Seung-hyun put the game to bed late on.
Pre-Game Insights: Jurgen Klinsmann’s side thumped Singapore 5-0 last week to begin their qualifying campaign in style.
Post-Match Reflections: South Korea wrapped the game up in the dying minutes through a bullet header by Jung Seung-hyun — from a Son set-piece — and top Group C with a perfect six points.
Miscellaneous Highlights: In other Asian World Cup qualifiers, North Korea thrashed Myanmar 6-1 away and Tajikistan won in Pakistan by the same scoreline.
Later Tuesday, Australia face Palestine in Kuwait, Japan play Syria in Jeddah and India host Qatar.
